The role in a nutshell

A Senior Software Engineer in UNiDAYS is a hands-on software development role focused on building innovative solutions to delight our members and drive product success in a fast-paced company.

It's more than just lines of code; we are looking for a commercially-minded Senior Software Engineer who can bridge the gap between user needs and business goals. You will have the ability to build resilient, cost-effective solutions and navigate evolving market demands.

You will be working closely alongside the rest of our product and engineering teams while defining, refining, building, and measuring the impact of the solutions you implement. These may be across our portfolio of marketplace products, identity products, or elsewhere as the business grows.

In order to be successful in this role, you will need to translate user needs into market-winning solutions, all while navigating technical challenges and ensuring commercial viability.

You will need an inquisitive mind as we continue to work with bleeding-edge technologies and split our core business logic out into Kotlin Multiplatform libraries (Note that prior experience with KMP is not required; on-the-job training/learning is fully supported).

Day to day responsibilities

  • Working in a cross-functional product team to build end-to-end solutions. This will involve taking part in the standard agile ceremonies, as well as collaborating with other team members in addition to designing/writing/debugging/testing/shipping/supporting the code you develop
  • Deliver impactful features with a pragmatic approach
  • Use your technical knowledge and experience to solve problems in the most appropriate way - balancing risks, constraints, user needs, and business needs
  • Championing user-centric solutions with a keen eye on market fit and profitability
  • Representing Android concerns within the team
  • Be an active contributor and promoter of the wider Android and Mobile team
  • You will work closely with your teammates to ensure the direction and standards set out for the team are delivered
  • Monitoring platform/feature performance & crashes, flagging issues, and writing tickets to address
  • Contribute to the design and architecture of software systems, ensuring that they are scalable, efficient, and maintainable
  • Collaborating with external stakeholders and peers
  • Support and challenge software engineers through pairing, knowledge sharing, documentation, and mentoring
  • From time to time - support our interview process by attending interviews, task assessments, and candidate feedback

What we need from you

In order to be your best self in this role, you will be/have:

  • Passionate about member experience and creating meaningful experiences for our users
  • Passionate about the Android and mobile problem space
  • Experience working in a cross-functional team and representing Android and mobile concerns
  • Ability to adapt and persevere through complex problem
  • Leadership skills
  • Able to motivate and mentor others
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Understanding of software development concepts
  • Proficient in Kotlin and to a lesser extent, Java
  • Proficient with Kotlin coroutines and flows
  • Experience with unit testing
  • Knowledge of REST APIs, 3rd Party SDK integration
  • Strong understanding of agile methodologies such as scrum, kanban etc.
  • Use of GIT and related tools

  • Jetpack Compose

title: Front End Developer
description:
i2 Group, a Harris Computer company, are seeking a skilled Front-End Developer with strong skills in JavaScript, Typescript, and React, to join one of our core enterprise development teams and help us enhance our i2 products and services, which are used by more than 2000 law enforcement, national security, military and major commercial organizations in 130 countries across the world.

The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in designing, developing, and maintaining current and new capability to an existing large customer base. If you are passionate about creating efficient and scalable solutions, have a strong command of front-end technologies, and are eager to collaborate within a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply.

This permanent position will be performed on a remote basis with a requirement to visit the i2 Office in Cambridge, UK as and when there is a business need to do so (circa 2 days per month).

Your duties and responsibilities will include (but will not be limited to):

· Helping develop and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable frontend code using HTML5/CSS3, JavaScript, TypeScript, and React.

· Working closely with cross-functional teams, including UI/UX designers, backend developers, and product managers, to deliver high-quality user interfaces.

· Ensuring the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs and optimize solutions for maximum speed and scalability.

· Integrating frontend components seamlessly using RESTful APIs and asynchronous request handling.

· Conducting thorough testing (automated and manual) to identify, fix bugs, and performance issues.

· Mentoring junior developers and promote knowledge sharing to enhance team skills and productivity.

· Staying up to date with the latest industry trends and technologies to ensure our applications are built using the best practices.

Our Technology Stack

· Frontend App Framework - JavaScript / TypeScript / React

· Frontend State Management - Mobx

· Backend – Java REST/GraphQL Services

· CI / CD - GitHub / CircleCI

· Cloud – AWS

What we are seeking:

· Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).

· Mid to senior level commercial front-end engineering experience.

· Demonstrable success and involvement in software design and implementation of production-ready clients using technologies such as: HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3, Typescript, and React

· Experience with APIs and using patterns such as REST and GraphQL.

· Experience with testing frameworks and methodologies, ensuring the delivery of high-quality software.

· Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

· Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Desirable (but not essential)

· Experience creating accessible and globalized web applications (A11Y, I18N + L10N).

· Good understanding of backend development using Node.js.

· Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and containerization (e.g., Docker).

About i2

Our intelligence analysis software tools help analysts transform data real-time enabling customers to better leverage data and to detect, disrupt and defeat sophisticated threats. Customers are better able to track critical missions across law enforcement, fraud and financial crime, military defense and national security. https://i2group.com

As a Harris Computer company, we strive to create a respectful and united environment where all members of our globally diverse community are empowered and have equitable opportunities to succeed.

Benefits

If you’re looking for a job with great benefits, Harris is the place to be! Harris offers an extremely competitive employee benefits program in the UK. In addition to the standard 25 days of leave and bank holidays, Harris employees are granted 5 Personal Days on top of that. Harris also offers an annual Lifestyle Reward of £325 to all UK employees. The program also includes Group Personal Pension, Life Assurance, Private Medical, and Dental. With Harris, you’ll have access to a wide range of benefits that will make your work life more enjoyable and fulfilling.

Supporting your application

Our recruitment process will comprise of interviews and, at times, a written exercise, an assessment day and/or a presentation. As an equal opportunities employer, we want to make sure we do all we can to make this a positive experience for you. When applying, please make us aware on your application of any adjustments or additional support we can provide you with before or on the day of an interview.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £60,000.00-£80,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

  • Burton-On-Trent: Relocate before starting work (required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Burton-On-Trent

title: Business Developer
description:
Business Systems Developer Ref code: JHS99095046 Technology £40k - 50k per year + Great training & Progression Burton upon Trent, Staffordshire, England Permanent Hybrid Working Business Systems Developer with strong SQL development skills and an aptitude for learning new technology is sought by a market leading SciTech based near Burton upon Trent. With a rich pedigree of creating scientific solutions for some of the worlds largest medical companies this company are looking for a Business Systems Developer to create bespoke software aimed at providing infrastructure for newly implemented ERP and software packages. This role would suit an established Business Systems Developer with a wide range of language exposure who is looking for an opportunity to learn new technologies as the business implements new enhancements, functionality and usability applications to their systems. In return this Business Systems Developer can expect an autonomous, dynamic working environment with extensive growth opportunities in a company that places employee engagement as the cornerstone of their successes. Role

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
About the role

While people will always be at the heart of our Society, we also recognise the increasingly powerful role data will play in our future success. So, as we grow, we’re continuing to strengthen our capabilities and now have a new exciting opportunity for a Senior BI Developer to join our new and growing Data Office team.

The Senior BI Developer will support data team members through upskilling, mentoring and coaching, so that the team can confidently drive BI solutions and approaches across the business.

The person in post will work within an agile data product team and engage with business stakeholders to understand their requirements in context to business intelligence, as well as design and develop meaningful data products. Through the collection, processing and interpreting of large and complex datasets, the Senior BI Developer will apply analytical techniques to generate meaningful MI, actionable insights and will present these to the business.

Our benefits include:

  • 28 days holiday a year plus bank holidays and a holiday buy/sell scheme
  • Annual discretionary bonus scheme
  • Personal pension with matched contributions
  • Life assurance (6 times annual salary)

Find out more about the fantastic benefits of joining Coventry Building Society here.

Role closure – 14th February

We do reserve the right to close this advertisement early if we receive a high volume of suitable applications.

About you

You’ll have advanced technical skills and considerable experience in Business Intelligence within the financial service industry. You will also have expert knowledge of various reporting/analytics tools (Power BI and Cognos - preferred, QlikView and Tableau - beneficial).

Experienced in data visualisation, building interactive and visually appealing dashboards and reports, you’ll have the ability to work closely with our business stakeholders, foster strong relationships and trust to understand their business needs and translate these to technical data requirements to then develop fit for purpose quality data products. You’ll play a pivotal role in developing a data culture and data mindset by proposing innovative new ideas and sharing the art of the possible with data.

You will have strong experience of implementing data governance and data risk principles in your BI solutions, building on cloud warehousing design and engineering. You’ll play a lead role in defining and establishing standards, formulating data product development lifecycles and methodologies, and embedding best practices for BI (both within the team and across the society).

As an excellent communicator, you’ll have the ability to use data to tell a story and present this to key stakeholders. You’ll have excellent attention to detail and a strong appreciation for end user report/dashboard consumption including design thinking and UX/UI principles.

You’ll have hands on experience of upskilling and training junior members of the team.

About us

As a mutual, we’ve always worked together to improve the lives of others. Now one of the largest Building Societies in the UK, over 3,000 of us share that goal, in our branches and Head Office. Our benefits go beyond basic pay, with a discretionary bonus scheme, a culture of reward and recognition and total support for our wellbeing.

We’re serious about equality, of race, age, faith, disability and sexual orientation, but also of personality and the way we think. By being yourself, you’ll make us stronger.

You can build so much more than a career. Come and make a difference in our Society, that’s been voted a ‘Great Place to Work’ by our teams.

Flexibility and why it matters

We understand the need for flexibility, so wherever possible, we’ll consider alternative working patterns. Have a chat with us before you apply to see what the possibilities are for this role.

Location


Coventry-Binley Business Park

Developer
description:
Agratas – Who are we?

We’re a global battery business within the Tata Group, scaling up to design, develop, and manufacture high-quality, high-performance, sustainable batteries across multiple applications and sectors to meet customers’ requirements.

Job Purpose

As a Manufacturing Process Developer, you will be responsible for designing and optimising the processes involved in the production of battery modules, packs, associated sub-assemblies & components for EVs, as well as energy storage solutions for other sectors. This role is crucial in the development of and efficient production of batteries.

Key Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Process Design and Development: Develop and design manufacturing processes for battery module and pack production. This includes determining the sequence of operations, selecting equipment, and specifying materials and assembly techniques.
  • Cost optimisation: Continuously work to improve the efficiency of the manufacturing processes while minimising production costs.
  • Quality Assurance: Ensure that the manufacturing processes meet strict quality and safety standards. This includes developing and implementing quality control measures and testing procedures to guarantee the reliability and safety of the batteries.
  • Material Selection: Select appropriate materials for battery components, considering factors like energy density, durability, and cost-effectiveness.
  • Equipment Selection and Maintenance: Choose and maintain the necessary machinery and equipment for battery production. This involves coordinating with equipment vendors and ensuring regular maintenance to minimize downtime.

Qualifications & Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in chemical engineering, electrical engineering, materials science, or a related field.
  • In depth knowledge of battery technologies and manufacturing processes.
  • Proficient in process design, optimisation and continuous improvement techniques.
  • Hands on experience in manufacturing and production processes.
  • Understanding of battery materials, including electrode materials, electrolytes, separators, and thermal management components.
  • Experience with CAD packages – AutoCAD, SolidWorks or Catia

At Agratas we strongly believe that people are at their best when they feel supported and happy in their workplace. To that end we continue to cultivate a diverse workforce which protects the individuality of each employee. We therefore warmly welcome applicants from any race, gender, sexuality, and ability.

Should you have a preference in how your suitability is assessed for this role or require any reasonable adjustments please let the Talent Acquisition team know.

  • Work from home

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

  • Bonus scheme

title: Java Developer
description:
Remote / Flexible / Variable Hours, Other Agile Working Arrangements / Open to Discussion

Can you think strategically and ‘join the dots’ across multiple activities to build the bigger picture? Do you enjoy working at pace, identifying new and improved ways of doing things and collaborating with a wide range of stakeholders? Are you passionate to develop new software’s in Java and make a difference to how our client operates?

If so, we would love to hear from you.

We are looking for Lead Java and React Software Developers to join our client’s team. As a Java Software Engineer, you will join one of our clients small, fast-paced, agile delivery teams; using agile methodology and DevOps techniques to build backend systems, data processing pipelines, and progressive web apps for customers.

Responsibilities

Java and React Software Engineering at our client’s organisation consists of a wide range of responsibilities, the list below gives a flavour of some of the tasks you may be asked to undertake.

  • Implementing Java software solutions including design, development, and testing.
  • Use a wide range of technologies, specialising in the use of open-source libraries and components.
  • Use tools such as GitLab to build continuous integration pipelines, which help monitor and ensure software quality and security.
  • Deploy Java software systems to a mixture of environments including public (AWS and Azure) and private cloud.

Full Software Lifecycle involvement:

  • Project concept formalisation
  • Requirement’s analysis and specification
  • Software architecture design
  • Software implementation and delivery
  • Software training and support
  • Software lifecycle and maintenance

Candidate specification

Our clients Java and React Software Engineers enjoy working on a variety of interesting and challenging projects, so they want their team to have a proactive and can-do attitude to their work. They pride on keeping up with emerging technologies and delivery best-practice, so it is important that you enjoy learning and continuous improvement.

You will ideally have exposure to.

  • Contemporary Java software engineering including selection and application of appropriate technology and patterns.
  • Confidence developing Java full-stack solutions as a polyglot developer/engineer.
  • DevOps and the techniques which enable it - including virtualisation, containerisation, continuous integration, continuous deployment, and infrastructure as code.
  • Working with high-level stakeholders - both internally and externally.
  • Working in agile environments using methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban.

Benefits

The Java and React Software Engineer role is an excellent opportunity, and our client reward their staff well with a competitive salary and impressive benefits package which includes:

  • Flexitime: 37.5 hour weeks to structure however you want with working from home available
  • Learning: Budget for conferences, training courses and other materials
  • Social: Fantastic culture with monthly social events
  • Future You: Matched pension and health care package

Our client understands the importance of getting to know your colleagues. Whole company meetings are held every quarter, and a training/work brief weekend is held once a year, amongst many other social events.

DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION

Our client is an equal opportunities employer. They embrace diversity and are committed to a working environment where no one will be treated less favourably on the grounds of their sex, race, disability, sexual orientation religion, belief, or age.

  • Work from home

title: Front End Developer
description:
If you’re a front-end developer looking to take the next step and join a busy digital marketing agency then we’d love to hear from you!

We’re looking for the right person to expand our front-end development team. As a FeD with at least 12 months experience already under your belt, you’ll be able to demonstrate your work with a strong portfolio of coded sites.

As a Front-end Developer at Adtrak, you’ll use your skills to build amazing sites that really perform for our clients, based on a user-focused and beautiful design from our internal UX designers. You’ll primarily work from home but enjoy our hybrid approach to work where you’ll join your team once a week in our Nottingham City Centre office.

Here’s what you’ll do:

  • You’ll code Wordpress themes from scratch based on a UX-focused Figma design. If your only experience with Wordpress is with visual page builders, this might not be for you.
  • You’ll use your skills in HTML, PHP, JS, Tailwind and Twig & Timber to build sites to specification and to deadline.
  • You’ll also flex your skills on content marketing projects, adding additional value and functionality to our existing portfolio of client sites.
  • You’ll be dealing with support tickets from clients.

Here’s what we’re looking for:

  • You’ll have great communication skills because you’ll be talking to clients and our internal account managers.
  • You’ll be an empathetic person who enjoys working with a large multi-disciplinary team.
  • You’ll be able to focus on your projects when required, but able to work on multiple project concurrently.
  • You’ll be adept at keeping our internal systems updated in a timely manner.
  • You’ll have 12 months industry or agency experience.
  • You’ll be a problem-solver, able to work through issues to find solutions autonomously, but know when to ask for help when required.
  • You’ll take feedback from managers and colleagues gracefully and in the spirit of improvement that it's intended.

Here’s what will really make you stand out:

  • Experience in WooCommerce, and / or Shopify Liquid theming.
  • Experience in Twig and Timber.
  • Experience in React, Gatsby, Next JS or similar.

Here’s what we’ll give you:

  • A supportive learning environment with monthly 1:1 and annual appraisal.
  • A competitive salary.
  • Great offices in Nottingham City Centre for your hybrid ‘team day’, with a great work area and social space.
  • Flexible working hours.
  • Company pension scheme.
  • Community server space for hosting your own sites.
  • A generous freelance policy.
  • Health top-up scheme for dental, optical and more.
  • Rewards scheme for discounts of high-street and online stores.
  • Kudos employee recognition scheme.
  • Ongoing social events.

If you think this all sounds great, then please apply with your CV and covering letter including salary expectations, telling us more about yourself. We don’t just look for skills, so your personality and willingness to join and be part of the team is really important to us.

No agencies, please.

title: Application Developer
description:
We are looking for a Full-stack mid-level software developer to join our dynamic and exciting team. The team of developers work on various end-to-end applications, creating in-house solutions that get rolled out across the network of private healthcare sites in the UK. This is a great opportunity to work for a leading healthcare company and be part of a team that makes a difference to help change lives.

Cygnet was established in 1988. Since then we have developed a wide range of health and social care services for young people and adults with mental health needs, acquired brain injuries, eating disorders, autism and learning disabilities within the UK.

Roles and Responsibilities:

As Mid-level Developer will be responsible in developing and delivering the assigned work with High standard and Bug Free.

The Role also involves joining with other Developers and peers in knowledge sharing, problem solving and finding solutions. As Part of the Process Developer will also be attend Daily Stand-up, Code-Review and collating the deliverable status.

Experience needed:

  • Experience of multiple, full-cycle application developments.
  • Experience of utilising Azure Dev-ops in an agile development environment
  • Proficiency in C#, with a good knowledge of its ecosystems
  • Strong skills using ASP.NET MVC 4.0 /5.0
  • Strong knowledge of .NET web framework 6 and .NET core
  • Strong Knowledge of SQL Server
  • Experience building Micro services with Web API
  • Experience in consuming and packaging Nuget Package
  • JavaScript, jQuery, Blazor is preferred

Why Cygnet? We’ll offer you…

  • An opening to undertake further learning with our excellent apprenticeship scheme
  • Expert supervision & support
  • Employee referral scheme
  • Free Health Cash plan
  • 24 hours free GP support line
  • Free life assurance cover
  • Free eye tests
  • Car lease discounts
  • Discounted gym membership
  • Free mortgage broker and Insurance cover
  • Pension scheme
  • Employee NHS - discount savings & “Cycle to Work” scheme
  • Smart Health Toolkit- Providing you with Fitness Programmes, Nutrition consultation and Health checks

Ready to make a positive change? Please click on the ‘apply now’ link below or send your CV to lenastreet@cygnethealth.co.uk

We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we receive sufficient applications for the role. Therefore, if you are interested, please submit your application as early as possible.

Are you passionate to develop new software’s in Java and make a difference to how our client operates?

If so, we would love to hear from you.

We are looking for Java Software Developers to join our client’s team. As a Java Software Engineer, you will join one of our clients small, fast-paced, agile delivery teams; using agile methodology and DevOps techniques to build backend systems, data processing pipelines, and progressive web apps for customers.

Responsibilities

Java Software Engineering at our client’s organisation consists of a wide range of responsibilities, the list below gives a flavour of some of the tasks you may be asked to undertake.

  • Implementing Java software solutions including design, development, and testing.
  • Use a wide range of technologies, specialising in the use of open-source libraries and components.
  • Use tools such as GitLab to build continuous integration pipelines, which help monitor and ensure software quality and security.
  • Deploy Java software systems to a mixture of environments including public (AWS and Azure) and private cloud.

Full Software Lifecycle involvement:

  • Project concept formalisation
  • Requirement’s analysis and specification
  • Software architecture design
  • Software implementation and delivery
  • Software training and support
  • Software lifecycle and maintenance

Candidate specification

Our clients Java Software Engineers enjoy working on a variety of interesting and challenging projects, so they want their team to have a proactive and can-do attitude to their work. They pride on keeping up with emerging technologies and delivery best-practice, so it is important that you enjoy learning and continuous improvement.

You will ideally have exposure to.

  • Contemporary Java software engineering including selection and application of appropriate technology and patterns.
  • Confidence developing Java full-stack solutions as a polyglot developer/engineer.
  • DevOps and the techniques which enable it - including virtualisation, containerisation, continuous integration, continuous deployment, and infrastructure as code.
  • Working with high-level stakeholders - both internally and externally.
  • Working in agile environments using methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban.

Benefits

The Java Software Engineer role is an excellent opportunity, and our client reward their staff well with a competitive salary and impressive benefits package which includes:

  • Flexitime: 37.5 hour weeks to structure however you want with working from home available
  • Learning: Budget for conferences, training courses and other materials
  • Social: Fantastic culture with monthly social events
  • Future You: Matched pension and health care package

Our client understands the importance of getting to know your colleagues. Whole company meetings are held every quarter, and a training/work brief weekend is held once a year, amongst many other social events.

DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION

Our client is an equal opportunities employer. They embrace diversity and are committed to a working environment where no one will be treated less favourably on the grounds of their sex, race, disability, sexual orientation religion, belief, or age.

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Who are we?

We provide products and services that are already improving the operational delivery of rail services. Our vision is to create a truly connected rail network, using our deep technology expertise and rail industry experience to deliver game-changing solutions that improve the quality of transport across the UK and beyond. We are a company that is excited by the possibilities offered by technology and are driven by improving experiences for passengers globally.

We have consistently innovated to create a best in the market product, delivering high levels of automation into complex operational environments. We continue to evolve our offer and recently integrated our technology with our own Traffic Management System; an operational and technical first. Our service offer continues to grow, taking advantage of technologies including cloud and data analytics.

To make this happen, we are seeking a highly skilled and versatile Infrastructure Engineer (to join our DevOps team) with a strong background in Linux servers (Ubuntu/Redhat) and AWS cloud to join our dynamic infrastructure team. You will play a pivotal role in ensuring the seamless operation, optimization, and automation of our application stack.

What are the key objectives?

  • Ensure our on-prem infrastructure and AWS cloud estate are ready and available to support our teams, digital services, and customers at all times
  • Provision environments and services that are used by our customers as well as our development, engineering, and test teams
  • Assist in deploying product updates, locating production errors, and building integrations that improve users’ experience
  • Create, manage, and maintain the Infrastructure as Code for the project, deploy and update docker stacks to a docker swarm, ensuring lab configurations as well as involvement in updating, rolling back the product version etc. This work is approximately 80% on-prem and 20% cloud based

Requirements

Personally, we are looking for:

  • An excellent problem-solver who shows initiative to deliver on their promises
  • A team player, not afraid to step out of their role where it is best for the team
  • Someone who is assured and approachable, able to build relationships and collaborate with others
  • Someone highly motivated, organised and able to manage their workload and commitments
  • A technical background with a keen attention to detail
    • Comprehensive communication skills

Technically, we are looking for someone who can hit the ground running, bring valuable insights and has demonstrated experience of:

  • Environment/Infrastructure Management, including provisioning and support for hardware, software, data, and network
  • Systems Administration Support, Security; User management; Upgrades/Patching; Scripting / Process Automation e.g. Ansible; Monitoring and System Analytics
  • Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment

Great to have, but not essential:

  • Worked with AWS Cloud services such as EC2 and S3, using CloudFormation and Terraform.
  • YAML based Azure DevOps pipelines.
  • Understanding of JSON language
  • AWS SysOps and Cloud Architecture Certifications
  • Advocate for DevOps culture and practices with Product and Project teams
  • Manage work items in Agile delivery lifecycle including updates to work items and active participation in ceremonies

Benefits

So that you can thrive both in and out of work we offer the following benefits on top of a competitive salary that rewards you for the value you bring:

  • Flexible working with a minimum requirement of one day in the office each week.
  • 27 days annual leave in addition to public holidays.
  • 3 “privilege days” scheduled between Christmas/New Year.
  • Pension plan with matched contributions from 5%-8%.
  • Private Healthcare that covers you and your immediate dependents.
  • Group Income Protection cover.
  • Life Assurance.
  • Enhanced maternity, paternity, and adoption policies.
  • Monthly divisional days that bring the whole team together.
  • Tailored and supported training and development to further your career.

This role could be based in Derby, Milton Keynes, or London. We have a flexible, hybrid approach to work and work location - so please talk to us about your preferences and how these could work for both you and the team. We do require everyone to be in one of our offices at least once a week. We provide this flexibility to enable you to work most effectively.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Position: Senior Software Engineer

Location: Shepshed, United Kingdom

Senior Software Engineer (Full Stack)

Shepshed, Loughborough, UK

About Us:

Welcome to Campbell Scientific UK

We are part of a dynamic international group recognized for its scientific instruments that accurately translate measurement data into usable information for a wide range of applications (water, energy, gas flux, soils, aviation, and infrastructure, etc.). Our reputation largely rest on our data acquisition and control systems for a wide range of sensors.

What sets us apart? The ability to offer a complete package to our clients, including not only measurement instruments but also a monitoring platform and associated services. Our vision: Provide customized and innovative solutions, backed up by excellent services

to deliver "The Best of the Best" to our customers. Our commitment: Foster innovation to create smarter applications, accelerate processing,

improve information dissemination, optimize data storage, and provide more reliable

insights.

Position Overview:

Join our team as a senior full-stack software engineer and contribute to the design and development of meteorological and climatological solutions for national meteorological services, civil and military aviation authorities, and international airports. You will delve into the field of meteorology, understand how meteorological information is transmitted and shared globally, and understand and describe meteorological and climatological phenomena.

In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and supporting software features for our Néo solution. You will work in a microservices and micro-frontend architecture (Angular, NestJS, Spring Boot/Quarkus, Go), within a containerized infrastructure (Docker, Swarm, and Kubernetes), and follow agile development practices

(Scrum).

Keywords: Meteorology, Climatology, Hydrometeorology, Aeronautical Meteorology,

Angular, NestJS, Typescript, Spring Boot, Quarkus, Geoserver, Java, OpenLayers,

RabbitMQ, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, TimescaleDB, Go

Responsibilities:

  • Implementation of software architecture solutions in a microservices environment (Docker Swarm, Kubernetes), focusing on observability, performance monitoring, log collection, scalability, and high availability, in collaboration with the DevOps team.
  • Assist the team in integrating practices related to software security in the development lifecycle (DevSecOps), such as automating vulnerability scans, reporting associated metrics, proposing solutions to address vulnerabilities identified in scans, OWASP top 10, and Pentest reports.
  • Design, develop, and support software features in a meteorological/climatological solution.
  • Participation in agile development practices, enhancement of our methodology, and proactive contribution.
  • Implementation of unit and end-to-end tests to support developed features.

You will also:

  • Work collaboratively with project managers and delivery team
  • Acquire expertise in meteorology and climatology through collaboration with domain experts.
  • Maintain a technology watch to keep abreast of new developments in IT. Required Qualifications:
  • Degree in Computer Science or equivalent Bachelor's degree (Engineering, Commerce).
  • Minimum of 5 years of software development experience.

Required Skills: · Languages: Javascript/Typescript, Java, Go.

  • Frameworks: Spring Boot, Spring Security, NestJS.
  • Execution environments: NodeJS, Java, Go.
  • Restful services in a microservices architecture.
  • Good knowledge of HTTP, TLS, AMQP (0.9, 1.0) protocols.
  • Knowledge of PostgreSQL, MongoDB databases.
  • Docker containerization in a cluster environment (Swarm/Kubernetes).

· Linux environment, Git. · Good level of English.

Preferred Assets: While not mandatory, experience or familiarity with any of the following is an asset: · Frameworks: Angular, AngularJS, Quarkus. · Familiarity with Geoserver. Our Values:

The selected profiles will align with our ARCTIC values (Responsibility, Respect, Customer Orientation, Teamwork, Innovation, and Continuous Improvement). What We Offer:

· A corporate culture that encourages commitment, collaboration, and job satisfaction. · Worldwide projects in meteorology and aviation. · Competitive remuneration. · Benefits such as Salary sacrifice pension and a bonus system.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Employer description:
We are a family-owned East Midlands based engineering manufacturing specialist supplying high integrity machined parts, assemblies, and fabrications to the nuclear, defence, aerospace and energy sectors.
It is important we continue to grow our business whilst retaining the family feel, living the company values and developing our people ready for tomorrow’s challenges. To do this successfully, every member of the SPE work family must know, understand and be accountable for the part they play towards the collective success of the business.

Overview:
SPE are offering an excellent opportunity to join a progressive, forward thinking team striving to innovate and problem solve to supply the business with state of the art software solutions.

The ideal candidate would be open to change, highly self-motivated and focused on problem solving. Delivering high quality results in a busy engineering environment can be a challenge, but it’s also an extremely rewarding environment.

Main purpose / duties:

  • Assist in supporting the business’s existing web based bespoke applications that are used internally
  • Contributing towards the full software development life cycle of any new projects or systems
  • Encouragement to suggest and trial new technologies based on training received
    Project ownership
  • Promote and embody SPE’s values
  • Liaise with key stakeholders throughout the business and effectively communicate and plan in a busy, high pressure environment
  • Supporting sprint planning and sprint reviews on a fortnightly basis
  • Identify and correct bugs and performance bottlenecks

This job description serves as a guide only to the main duties and responsibilities of your job role and it may vary from time to time. As our business grows and develops (or contracts) you may be expected to carry out other reasonable duties, which are within your capabilities.

What we are looking for:
Skills & knowledge:

  • Strong communication skills
  • Enjoy a challenge and work using own initiative
  • Have a ‘can do’ attitude showing a methodical approach to work and good problem-solving skills
  • Have a keen eye for detail and quality
  • To be able to communicate with a wide range of people and enjoy a fast paced environment
  • Demonstrate extensive range of knowledge, understanding and application of curriculum development, innovation and delivery
  • Professional approach at all times

Entry requirements:
7 GCSE's total:

  • English GCSE grade D or above
  • Other 6 GCSE's, including Maths, to be C or above
    You must not hold an existing qualification at the same or higher level than this apprenticeship in a similar subject

You may also have a combination of qualifications and experience which demonstrate the minimum foundation needed for the programme. In this instance you could still be considered for the programme.

If you hold international equivalents of the above qualifications, at the time of your application you must be able to provide an official document that states how your international qualifications compare to the UK qualifications.

For more information, please visit the UK ENIC website.

Working week:
Monday > Friday working pattern.
Flexible working + early finish on Friday – 40 hrs a week.

What we offer / Benefits:

  • Contributory Pension scheme
  • 25 days holiday + statutory days
  • Christmas shut down
  • Health care cash plan – Dentist, Opticians, Consultants, Instant GP Access and Wellness services
  • Free onsite secure parking
  • Potential to progress internally after successfully completing the apprenticeship

Note:
Due to the nature of the work & industries supported within this position you will be subject to requiring security clearances, therefore, we are unable to support visa applications from residents outside of the UK. Only applicants meeting this criteria will be considered.

SPE are committed to safeguarding. Any offer of employment is subject to a DBS Check.

Future prospects:
90% of QA Apprentices secure permanent employment after finishing their apprenticeship.
Additionally, there may be opportunities to undertake further apprenticeship training as many of our programs offer on-going development tracks.

Important information:
Our apprenticeships are the perfect way to gain new skills, earn while you learn, and launch yourself into an exciting future. With over 30,000 successful apprenticeship graduates, we're a top 50 training provider, dedicated to helping you succeed.
Apply now!

title: Software Engineer
description:
About the business:
LexisNexis Risk Solutions is the essential partner in the assessment of risk. Within our Insurance vertical, we provide customers with solutions and decision tools that combine public and industry specific content with advanced technology and analytics to assist them in evaluating and predicting risk and enhancing operational efficiency. Our insurance risk solutions help drive better data-driven decisions across the insurance policy lifecycle – all while reducing risk. You can learn more about LexisNexis Risk at the link below.
https://risk.lexisnexis.com/insurance

About our team:
  • We are focused on building high quality software to meet the challenges of our industry, creating systems to serve transactions at high volume to our business partners.
  • We create teams of innovative, enthusiastic software engineers to build systems to transform our industry.
  • We use a variety of technologies and are creating our next generation of services based on microservice architecture.
About the job:
  • This is a hands-on coding role, part of a cross functional team, working with other developers, quality, and operations engineers.
  • You’ll be working on the development of new products and product enhancements, delivering multiple different sources of data to our customers.
  • You'll be involved with design, documentation, support and implementation of new microservices as well as maintaining the current services.
You’ll be responsible for:
  • Interface with other technical personnel or team members to finalize requirements.
  • Write and review of detailed specifications for the development of system.
  • Work closely with other development team members to understand product requirements and translate them into software designs.
  • Successfully implement development processes, coding best practices, and code reviews.
  • Implementing Agile processes, tools, and techniques to build efficiency, deliver value and shape best-practice in collaboration with key stakeholders.
  • Completing bug fixes and resolving technical issues to ensure quality and performance.
  • Levelling up our engineering practices by mentoring engineers, sharing knowledge and learning across our organization.
  • Keep abreast of new technology developments.
  • All other duties as assigned.
Requirements:
  • Java Development experience
  • Spring Boot framework experience
  • Web Services (SOAP, RESTful)
  • Test Driven Development
  • Ability to work well with internal and external technology resources.
  • Keen to learn new technology and adapt to change.
  • Strong written and oral communication skill
  • Good team player, interactive, be able to work well with other team members.
  • Creative, problem solver, innovative, can actively participate to give ideas / solutions.
  • Being able to help other team members.
  • Degree in Computer Science, related discipline, or relevant experience
Preferred skills:
  • Kubernetes / Docker
  • Github workflow
  • AWS, incl Terraform.
  • Agile / SCRUM
  • PHP, SQL, XML
Women in technology:
LexisNexis® Risk Solutions is very supportive of women in Technology and has been a founding signature for the Tech Talent Charter. Currently 26.2% of our Technology workforce are women which is much higher than the UK average of 17%. We have the following initiatives in place to support women in technology:
  • Mentoring scheme for women in technology
  • Women’s network forum
  • Regularly run events for schools girl about careers in technology to inspire the next generation of girls in tech.
Culture and benefits:
Learn more about the LexisNexis Risk team and how we work
here
#LI-Hybrid
#LI-SJ1
At LexisNexis Risk Solutions, having diverse employees with different perspectives is key to creating innovative new products for our global customers. We have 30 diversity employee networks globally and prioritize inclusive leadership and equitable processes as part of our culture. Our aim is for every employee to be the best version of themselves. We would actively welcome applications from candidates of diverse backgrounds and underrepresented groups.
We are committed to providing a fair and accessible hiring process. If you have a disability or other need that requires accommodation or adjustment, please let us know by completing our Applicant Request Support Form:

title: Lead Developer
description:
Position: Lead Developer
Company: Insolvency Service
Location: Hybrid/Nottingham
Contract: Full-time, permanent
Salary: Up to £58,828 + 35% pension

*

About Insolvency Service

Insolvency Service is a leading Government agency that supports people and companies in financial difficulties, champions creditors’ interests and ensure that commerce functions fairly and transparently. You will operate at our heart – strengthening a friendly multidisciplinary team that develops, supports and maintains all our line-of-business applications.

In the last 12 months, Insolvency Service have supported over 120,000 people in financial difficulty through our bankruptcy, debt relief order and breathing space services. The work Insolvency Service do has a big impact on people’s lives every day, often when they’re at their most desperate and vulnerable, so it is vital that great services are delivered with the utmost care and professionalism.

The solutions you deliver will enable people to rebuild their finances, secure breathing space from their creditors, obtain redundancy payments and hold fraudulent directors to account, so you will transform thousands of lives every year.

*

What’s the role about?

We’re looking for a Lead .NET Developer to join our busy, multidisciplinary team in Digital Services, Insolvency Service. Digital Services are responsible for developing, maintaining and supporting the agency’s line of business applications.

Digital Services is a predominantly an in-house team, with a small 3rd party DevSecOps function. We’ve recently moved away from a hybrid development and support partnership, with the aim of bringing the function in-house. We’d love to for you to be part of that new team.

We provide key services including:

  • Service Governance
  • Business Relationship Management
  • Service Architecture
  • Digital Services
  • Cyber Security and Information Governance
  • Digital Programme Delivery

*

What will you do?

  • Lead our Developers in one of our agile teams, acting as a mentor, coach as well as being one of our Principal Developers
  • Be able to guide the way that the other developers in the team work
  • Be proficient in a wide range of technical systems
  • To be involved in identifying appropriate technology and approaches, deciding when software should be written
  • Contribute to the developer community
  • Proomote a culture of knowledge sharing and the adoption of good practice

*

What do you need?

  • You will be a subject matter expert in .NET
  • You will be an experienced lead supporting and mentoring junior developers
  • You will have experience as a full stack developer, used to working on frontend, API/Webservice and database applications
  • You will have experience in developing for the cloud, preferably Microsoft Azure
  • You will be proficient at implementing software development patterns and standards such as MVC, REST, SOLID, SOA, OIDC or OAUTH.
  • You will demonstrate an understanding of integration patterns such as real-time, scheduled, API, batch or messaging services
  • You will be proficient at implementing and checking code quality including adoption of Test-Driven Development, peer reviews and code analysis
  • You will have experience of working in a multi-disciplinary team in an Agile fashion

Desirable

  • Familiarity with GOV.UK’s Service Standards and building services against those standards would be beneficial

*

What’s in it for me?

  • Civil Service Pension
  • Advances on salary (EFA Advances)
  • Wellbeing and mental health support
  • Civil Service Sports Club
  • Recognition of hard work: INSpire and GEM awards
  • Flexible working and flexi hours
  • Discounts on days out and activities
  • Learning and Development opportunities
  • Relocation schemes including ‘Places for Growth’

*

Please note that sponsorship is not available with this opportunity

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £51,518.00-£58,828.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work authorisation:

  • United Kingdom (required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Nottingham

title: .NET Developer
description:
As a family-owned business our people are central to our success, and following years of organic, consecutive growth, we’re looking for people who share our core values of sustainability, trust, collaboration, and innovation to drive us forwards.
Software never stays the same and neither do we. We want our people to be part of a progressive organisation, encouraged to embrace change and new ideas to shape our future development. Your input is vital, which is why we’re committed to personalised learning paths for every employee to help you, and us, grow.
Our goal is to make the world of work easier as a leader in the HR, payroll, finance, and integration solutions software and services industry. We’re proud to design and develop some of the best business solutions like iTrent and People First to support our customers’ people-related challenges across every vertical.
Looking for the place where you can belong? Join MHR and help us shape the world of work.

Provide high quality and effective product development. Drive technical change, review code base and ensure that everyone is following same technical direction. Act as a bridge between architecture and the production team.

  • Driving technical change, working closely with the engineering and development manager, leads and the architects, scheduling in workshops and training days.
  • Coaching software engineers.
  • Working closely with the architecture team, reviewing their proposal and aligning them with our code base/product.
  • Produce prototypes that could be handed over to the software engineers for full scale development.
  • Constantly review code base, propose suggestions, where we can remove waste, complexity, inefficiency and misalignment.
  • Undertake research as required and attend conferences and events, documenting afterwards to extend the team knowledge.
  • Documenting decisions and progress in line with corporate and team project management.
  • Identify and resolve development issues for other team members.
  • Hands on coding as required.
  • Participate where required in employee recruitment process.

Support:
Assess the impact of reported or suspected product defects and advise accordingly.

  • Advise on, produce and test product corrections in accordance with prevailing standards.
  • Provide advice and assistance to meet time critical or contractual commitments.
  • Respond to customer queries directly, professionally and effectively.
  • On agreement, attend on customer site to undertake product-related tasks.

Organisation:

  • Identify product or procedural deficiencies and recommend action.
  • Proactively record and disseminate product and technical knowledge to colleagues and throughout the organisation as appropriate.
  • Identify requirements and opportunities for personal development including technical and product training.

Key Skills:

  • C#
  • REST
  • Unit Testing
  • SQL-Hibernate/JPA
  • Design Patterns
  • Build Tools
  • Infrastructure
  • OOP
  • DDD
  • Performance Testing
  • Security

How We Work:

  • Azure DevOps is used to manage backlogs, builds and releases.
  • Core hours are used to minimise interruptions to developers.
  • Our products are shipped at least every two weeks.
  • We sponsor tech events such as Tech Nottingham and Hack24.

Your Development:

  • You will be actively encouraged to grow your skills by pursing self-learning or attending conferences.
  • You can either broaden your knowledge by learning new skills within the .NET sphere, or by branching out into other areas like Angular, Java or Azure.
  • You will be surrounded by other experienced developers

Benefits to support you personally and professionally

In addition to working with amazing people, with the freedom to be you, we provide a range of tailored benefits including:

  • Access to over 60 internal training courses, plus the ability to study for professional qualifications as well as cross-departmental mentoring and coaching programmes
  • Access to a GP 24/7, via SmartHealth - whole family access to GPs, confidential mental health support and the security of paid sick leave
  • Option to buy and sell additional holiday days on top of your standard 25 days and bank holidays
  • Discounts and cash back on leisure, travel, technology, fashion, gym memberships and food
  • Monthly company employee recognition programme and departmental awards
  • Referral bonus scheme up to £2,000
  • Employee-led social events, including running clubs, football teams, book club and bake-offs
  • Subsidised restaurants with a choice of fresh meals from our chefs each day
  • Opt-in benefits schemes, ranging from private medical insurance to dental

We care about the health, wellbeing and financial stability of our people and want to ensure they’re working in an inclusive and supportive environment.

title: System Engineer
description:
We currently have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a CNC/PLC Systems & Software Engineer (Machine control systems) based in Binley, Coventry. You will join us on a full-time, permanent basis, and in return, you will receive a competitive salary of £40,000-£60,000 depending on skills/experience and ability.

About the CNC/PLC Systems & Software Engineer role

You will be working on new and exciting projects, alongside the on-going development of existing product lines, responsible for the design & integration of Fanuc and Siemens CNC systems and Siemens PLC systems.

You will be designing, implementing, updating & maintaining multi-axis (up to 28 axes/ 13 path) control systems and be a key part of the complete product development, suggesting new ideas and areas for improvement based on your experience.

For the right person, although not on a frequent basis, there will also be opportunity for some travel outside the UK, with engineers having travelled to, Europe, Americas & Asia previously.

About us:

Wickman Coventry Ltd is an OEM Machine tool, design and manufacturing, organisation, now in its 99th year. We produce our specialised range of Multi-spindle CNC and Automatic Lathes from our Coventry factory. This is an excellent opportunity to join a long-established technology lead company with a diverse range of work on offer to a bright, enthusiastic individual.

Benefits we offer:

  • Generous holiday entitlement – with flexibility to allow part day booking
  • Flexibility in working times
  • Contributory Pension scheme
  • Cycle to work scheme

Your responsibilities as our CNC/PLC Systems & Software Engineer will include

  • Production and maintenance of electrical schematics and Bills of material based on an Electrical CAD system (WSCAD)
  • Developing control systems & software for PLC machines and CNC machines with up to 28 axes and13 simultaneous path control
  • Integration of ancillary equipment on to our standard machine platforms
  • Working as part of a team including process engineers and mechanical designers to develop and prove machine operation
  • Technical direction and management of the machine wireman (Not administrative management)
  • Training of the machine wireman to undertake basic commissioning tasks (software loading and configuration etc.)
  • Commissioning of machinery
  • Training in machine operation
  • Produce manuals & technical documents relating to the machines control and operation
  • Maintain the necessary records for the technical file in respect of CE marking (Electrical Elements)
  • Implementation of design solutions/upgrades and add-ons to existing control designs
  • Liaison with external suppliers to ensure concept feasibility
  • Specification & procurement of systems to ensure they meet the design requirements
  • Liaise with clients and colleagues to ensure that the specification requirements are fully met
  • Supporting colleagues and customers with technical issues relating to the machine control.

What we’re looking for in our CNC/PLC Systems & Software Engineer:

  • An enthusiasm for machine tool control systems
  • Ability to work with minimum direction
  • Either: A proven track record in CNC /PLC design & Applications or An ability and willingness to learn
  • The ability to communicate with all levels of personnel within the company, from shop floor to the MD
  • A willingness to “get stuck in” and a hands-on approach to do whatever is required to progress a project (e.g. Making wiring modifications, removing/refitting covers etc.)
  • The knowledge and ability to understand the system designs that are already in use
  • Strong time and project management skills, with the ability to work on several projects simultaneously
  • Computer literate in MS packages
  • Some experience of Electrical CAD Systems. WSCAD would be ideal.

If you’re looking for a new challenge, please click apply now to be considered as our CNC/PLC Systems & Software Engineer, we look forward to hearing from you!

title: Software Engineer
description:
Digital Technology Software Engineering Degree Apprenticeship

At E.ON, we help our customers to take control of their energy use and we are always looking for new and improved ways of doing things. E.ON has customers across a variety of industries, using the latest technology to help build a better energy future. In Digital Technology, we work to support business areas by automating processes and building new solutions to drive innovation.

Here's what you'll be doing

As part of the four-year Digital Technology degree apprenticeship, you will have the opportunity to gain practical, hands-on experience working with a variety of teams through six-month placements across the business. As an apprentice, you will be employed by E.ON but will study part-time at Nottingham Trent University for a fully-funded BSc (Hons) in Digital and Technology Solutions (Software Engineering).

You will have the opportunity to select placements to suit your interests and skills, examples include:

  • Spend time with the cyber security team helping to protect our colleagues and customers through supporting penetration testing, exploring vulnerabilities and investigating fraudulent companies.
  • Contribute to our data strategy.
  • Learn about what E.ON does to contribute to sustainability, get involved yourself, while helping automate and digitalise processes.
  • Understand how a Digital Technology operation functions, reviewing budget controls and working with suppliers to fulfil technology needs.

Throughout your time on the programme, you will be fully supported at E.ON by the early careers talent team, your mentor and a dedicated buddy from a previous degree apprenticeship scheme.

There is the opportunity for part of a placement to be completed overseas at an E.ON office in Germany, plus work with international colleagues on placements within the UK.

What we need from you
  • 5 GCSEs or equivalent, including grade 4 or above in English Language and grade 5 or above in Maths.
  • 3 A-Levels including either Maths, Science or IT totalling 120 UCAS points or equivalent (for example level 3 BTEC in computer science or IT, relevant T-level). Additional A-levels which will not be accepted are citizenship skills, general studies and critical thinking. A preceding level apprenticeship or equivalent demonstrable work experience in the occupation area can be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.
Here’s what you need to know
  • Your base location will be our offices in either Nottingham or Coventry. We operate a hybrid working model, and though this may vary from placement to placement, you will be expected to come into the office between 1-3 days a week, with home working an option on other days. Other company funded travel will be required and this role will also include placement opportunities at other E.ON sites across the UK.
  • This apprenticeship leads to a BSc (Hons) in Digital and Technology Solutions (Software Engineering) awarded by Nottingham Trent University. This is done on block release, currently spending six blocks (each of five days) on campus each year.
  • We offer an initial starting salary of £19,350 with potential pay progressions throughout the scheme based on academic and placement performance.
  • Our market leading benefits package includes 26 days’ holiday plus eight bank holidays, a generous pension scheme, and the chance to choose from 20 flexible benefits, including the option to buy up to two weeks’ extra holiday.
  • Please note, you may only apply for one E.ON degree/level 7 apprenticeship scheme, so please choose the one that suits you best.

E.ON is committed to being an inclusive employer. We recognise that everyone is different and we aim to provide a working environment where each person feels respected, valued and able to achieve their full potential. We are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. If you require any reasonable adjustments, please just let us know.

At a glance

Reference no.:

222837

Closing date:

01/03/2024

Salary:

£19,350
Get in touch

For more information please contact EarlyCareers@eon-uk.com

About us
E.ON is a privately owned international energy company. Our 75,000 colleagues in 15 countries work daily towards the improvement of technical innovations and user-friendly customer solutions for the new energy world. We are the first large energy company to focus more heavily upon the energy of the future through our three business areas of energy networks, renewable energies and customer solutions.
Connect with us

www.eon-uk-careers.com

title: Back End Developer
description:
Job title: Back-End Engineer

Team: Offer Management

Location: Amsterdam/Groningen, NL - or - Fully-remote from a complimentary timezone

Environment: On-site/Hybrid/Remote (you decide!)

Timezone: +/- 2 hours of CET

Language: Our business language is English



Where the journey began…

From humble beginnings when travelling back in 2014, our co-founders at Parkos embarked on our journey to ensure that the beginning and end of your travel experience are as enjoyable as the actual adventure between!

We make airport parking a smooth, seamless and efficient process for all travellers using our TravelTech price comparison & booking platform.

We started off by winning the major airports within the Netherlands and now operate in over 15 different countries and 3 different regions (and counting)! We’ve grown to over 120 Parkie’s and millions of travellers choose Parkos every year!


The team

Our Offer Management team currently consists of a mixture of long-standing Developers (both mid-level and senior+), a dedicated Product Manager, and an Engineering Team Lead.

They own topics that deal with our parking merchants and airport partners including fast search, digital inventory management, and competitor analysis to ensure our customer-base is getting the very best deal on their airport parking!

We’ve experienced rapid growth in recent years and have introduced a microservices strategy based around Kubernetes to leave our monolith behind and to standardise our processes. On the back-end, we are enabling this by utilising Node.js, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and SQL databases.


What you’ll do

  • Build inventory search and data management systems that support core price and availability comparison

  • Provide mentorship and guidance to less senior developers

  • Influence technical decisions across teams

  • Independently work on tasks, contribute to team projects, and occasionally lead small projects

  • Identify, prioritise, and solve high-impact problems. Proactively propose improvements and identify risks while managing time responsibly


What you’ll bring

  • Proficiency in JavaScript (TypeScript), back-end engineering principles such as search optimisation and IO performance tuning

  • Functional programming experience is highly desirable but we also welcome candidates who can demonstrate proficiency.

  • Strong understanding of time complexity of algorithms and data structures. Experience with build tools, version control systems, and CI/CD pipelines.

  • Experience working with remote, distributed teams in an agile, multi-region environment having a strong sense of ownership

  • Effective communication skills with an ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

  • A continuous learning mentality and an interest in keeping up-to-date with technological advances and industry standards


What we offer

  • Flexible working: We understand that people’s circumstances vary and allow you to decide where you work from. We can support on-site, hybrid, and fully-remote (so long as the timezones aren’t too far apart!)

  • Ownership: Take ownership of your work and have the opportunity to drive lasting change within Parkos

  • Growth: We provide the autonomy and personal development support for you to move quickly through the ranks at Parkos - the sky's the limit!

  • Transparency: We talk about our plans, allow everyone a voice, work together towards common objectives, and share our successes together as a team

  • Fast-pace: We love to experiment and try new things quickly. An error is only a mistake when you fail to correct it and we want to reach our destination as swiftly and smoothly as possible!

  • A modern (MACH) architecture: We work with a solid and modern software architecture to ensure all our applications are running smoothly and at scale. In cooperation with the DevOps team, we continuously refine our processes, applications and infrastructure.


The road ahead…

  • Fit Interview with recruiter (45 mins)

  • Technical Assignment (3 hours)

  • Pair programming & Team Q&A (1 hour)

  • Executive Interview (1 hour)


Step 3 will extend your own solution from step 2. During step 3 we will add 2 features and discuss the strengths and weaknesses of different approaches. We recommend using Visual Studio Code which has excellent remote pair programming extensions such as Live Share but we are open to you using the editor of your choice as long as we can participate using tools that give us equivalent access to that provided by Live Share.

-

At Parkos, we are fully committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace, free from discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, or any other protected characteristic. We foster an environment where all employees are valued, respected, and empowered, complying with all applicable laws to ensure fairness and equity. Embracing diversity enhances our company culture and strengthens our ability to serve our customers, and we continuously strive to promote equal opportunities through collaboration, support, and ongoing improvement.

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen within this leading Hinckley based manufacturing company for a Software Test Engineer to join its growing engineering department.

THE ROLE

Your main responsibilities will be:

  • Collaborate closely with Project Managers and developers to thoroughly test products.
  • Test functionality during sprints in collaboration with the development team.
  • Develop and maintain comprehensive test plans.
  • Define, write, and implement test cases based on acceptance criteria.
  • Contribute to improving test processes and automation in an agile environment.
  • Establish expertise within the team for QA and Automation matters.
  • Create scripts and test tools to support testing efforts.
  • Effectively use bug reporting and task management systems.
  • Design and execute test scenarios demonstrating product behavior.
  • Monitor and escalate system-related defects for timely resolution and re-testing

THE PERSON

In order to succeed in the role of Software Test Engineer you will ideally have some relevant experience in software or in automated testing. This role would also suit a graduate that is keen to move their career into this area. You will need to be self-motivated with strong decision-making skills and the ability to work alone or within a small team.

THE PACKAGE

description:

Posted 02 January 2024

title: Java Developer
description:
Remote / Flexible / Variable Hours, Other Agile Working Arrangements / Open to Discussion

Can you think strategically and ‘join the dots’ across multiple activities to build the bigger picture? Do you enjoy working at pace, identifying new and improved ways of doing things and collaborating with a wide range of stakeholders? Are you passionate to develop new software’s in Java and make a difference to how our client operates?

If so, we would love to hear from you.

We are looking for Java Software Developers to join our client’s team. As a Java Software Engineer, you will join one of our clients small, fast-paced, agile delivery teams; using agile methodology and DevOps techniques to build backend systems, data processing pipelines, and progressive web apps for customers.

Responsibilities

Java Software Engineering at our client’s organisation consists of a wide range of responsibilities, the list below gives a flavour of some of the tasks you may be asked to undertake.

  • Implementing Java software solutions including design, development, and testing.
  • Use a wide range of technologies, specialising in the use of open-source libraries and components.
  • Use tools such as GitLab to build continuous integration pipelines, which help monitor and ensure software quality and security.
  • Deploy Java software systems to a mixture of environments including public (AWS and Azure) and private cloud.

Full Software Lifecycle involvement:

  • Project concept formalisation
  • Requirement’s analysis and specification
  • Software architecture design
  • Software implementation and delivery
  • Software training and support
  • Software lifecycle and maintenance

Candidate specification

Our clients Java Software Engineers enjoy working on a variety of interesting and challenging projects, so they want their team to have a proactive and can-do attitude to their work. They pride on keeping up with emerging technologies and delivery best-practice, so it is important that you enjoy learning and continuous improvement.

You will ideally have exposure to.

  • Contemporary Java software engineering including selection and application of appropriate technology and patterns.
  • Confidence developing Java full-stack solutions as a polyglot developer/engineer.
  • DevOps and the techniques which enable it - including virtualisation, containerisation, continuous integration, continuous deployment, and infrastructure as code.
  • Working with high-level stakeholders - both internally and externally.
  • Working in agile environments using methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban.

Benefits

The Java Software Engineer role is an excellent opportunity, and our client reward their staff well with a competitive salary and impressive benefits package which includes:

  • Flexitime: 37.5 hour weeks to structure however you want with working from home available
  • Learning: Budget for conferences, training courses and other materials
  • Social: Fantastic culture with monthly social events
  • Future You: Matched pension and health care package

Our client understands the importance of getting to know your colleagues. Whole company meetings are held every quarter, and a training/work brief weekend is held once a year, amongst many other social events.

DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION

Our client is an equal opportunities employer. They embrace diversity and are committed to a working environment where no one will be treated less favourably on the grounds of their sex, race, disability, sexual orientation religion, belief, or age.

Salary: £50,000.00-£70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Additional leave
  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Employee discount
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Private dental insurance
  • Private medical insurance
  • Referral programme
  • Sick pay
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Flexitime

  • Bonus scheme
  • Loyalty bonus
  • Performance bonus
  • Yearly bonus

  • Deploy Java software systems to a mixture of environments including public (AWS and Azure) and private cloud.

Full Software Lifecycle involvement:

  • Project concept formalisation
  • Requirement’s analysis and specification
  • Software architecture design
  • Software implementation and delivery
  • Software training and support
  • Software lifecycle and maintenance

Candidate specification

Our clients Java Software Engineers enjoy working on a variety of interesting and challenging projects, so they want their team to have a proactive and can-do attitude to their work. They pride on keeping up with emerging technologies and delivery best-practice, so it is important that you enjoy learning and continuous improvement.

You will ideally have exposure to.

  • Contemporary Java software engineering including selection and application of appropriate technology and patterns.
  • Confidence developing Java full-stack solutions as a polyglot developer/engineer.
  • DevOps and the techniques which enable it - including virtualisation, containerisation, continuous integration, continuous deployment, and infrastructure as code.
  • Working with high-level stakeholders - both internally and externally.
  • Working in agile environments using methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban.

Benefits

The Java Software Engineer role is an excellent opportunity, and our client reward their staff well with a competitive salary and impressive benefits package which includes:

  • Flexitime: 37.5 hour weeks to structure however you want with working from home available
  • Learning: Budget for conferences, training courses and other materials
  • Social: Fantastic culture with monthly social events
  • Future You: Matched pension and health care package

Our client understands the importance of getting to know your colleagues. Whole company meetings are held every quarter, and a training/work brief weekend is held once a year, amongst many other social events.

DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION

Our client is an equal opportunities employer. They embrace diversity and are committed to a working environment where no one will be treated less favourably on the grounds of their sex, race, disability, sexual orientation religion, belief, or age.

title: Hardware and Mechatronics Graduate in Product Engineering for Luxury Brand
Senior Developer
description:
Epicor Senior Developer

Acro Aircraft Seating is one of the UK’s leading and fastest-growing manufacturers of passenger seats for commercial airlines around the world. We are an agile, innovative business at the forefront of disrupting the aerospace market. Through modern methodologies, lean techniques, inspired innovation, and passion for being the best, Acro is positioning itself to be the world’s leading aircraft seating supplier.

Collaboration is one of Acro’s core values, by working together and applying our skills and expertise across Sales, Engineering, Quality, Supply Chain and Operations, we find the solutions to our clients’ most complex challenges and how we deliver our promises today and tomorrow.
